trending.reason: The rediscovery of three deep, precisely engineered shafts suggests a sophisticated and unexplored subterranean architecture beneath the Giza pyramids.
Tesla has unveiled the second generation of its Optimus humanoid robot, which is lighter, faster, and demonstrates significantly more advanced capabilities.

articles.title: Rediscovery of Three Shafts May Lead to Underworld Beneath Giza Pyramids
articles.excerpt: The rediscovery of three deep shafts at Giza suggests a sophisticated and unexplored subterranean architecture beneath the pyramids.
articles.author: Gary Manners
articles.fullContent:
One of the rediscovered vertical shafts at Giza. Courtesy of Armando Mei.

Rediscovered Shafts Hint at Vast Subterranean Network at Giza

Three precisely engineered shafts hidden beneath the sands of Egypt's Giza Plateau have been rediscovered, potentially unlocking access to a vast underground network described by ancient historians. Located in the area between the Great Sphinx and the pyramids of Khufu and Khafre, these vertical passages descend over 40 metres into the bedrock with a precision that challenges conventional explanations of their purpose.

Echoes of a Lost Labyrinth

The shafts may provide the first physical evidence for the accounts of the ancient Greek historian Herodotus, who wrote of a massive, 3,000-chamber labyrinth in Egypt, much of it hidden underground. For centuries, scholars have debated whether Herodotus's account was fact or fiction. These rediscovered passages, combined with modern scanning technologies that have revealed anomalies beneath the plateau, suggest the ancient writer may have been describing a real architectural wonder that has eluded archaeologists until now.

"Every measurement, every radar image, points to a singular conclusion: the Giza Plateau still holds secrets that could reshape our understanding of ancient Egypt. The shafts are more than anomalies; they are doorways into a subterranean world waiting to be explored." — Armando Mei, Khafre Research Project

The purpose of these shafts remains a mystery, though theories suggest they could have been part of a sophisticated water management system, ventilation for underground structures, or access to ceremonial spaces. What is becoming clear is that the Giza Plateau contains an extensive subterranean dimension that has been largely overlooked by conventional archaeology.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ Three deep, precisely engineered shafts have been rediscovered on the Giza Plateau.
  • ✔ The shafts descend over 40 metres and are located between the Sphinx and the great pyramids.
  • ✔ The discovery may lend credibility to ancient accounts of a vast underground labyrinth by the historian Herodotus.
  • ✔ Researchers believe the Giza Plateau holds a significant, unexplored subterranean dimension that could reshape our understanding of ancient Egypt.

articles.title: Graphic Designer
articles.excerpt: A Graphic Designer is required for a full-time position in Perth, focusing on marketing and promotional materials.
articles.author: Seek
articles.fullContent:
Role Overview

Full-time📍 Perth, WAPosted: Oct 14, 2025

A dynamic and creative Graphic Designer is sought for a full-time position in Perth. The role focuses on developing compelling marketing and promotional materials across a variety of platforms to enhance brand presence and engage target audiences.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and produce marketing collateral including brochures, flyers, and digital advertisements.
  • Develop visual concepts for social media campaigns and website content.
  • Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure brand consistency across all materials.
  • Manage multiple design projects from concept through to completion.

Required Qualifications

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design or a related field.
  • Experience: Proven experience in a similar graphic design role.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
  • Soft Skills: Strong communication, creativity, and time-management skills.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary package.
  • A collaborative and creative work environment.
  • Opportunities for professional development and growth.
  • Work on a diverse range of exciting projects.

Application Instructions

To apply, please submit your resume and a portfolio of your work through the SEEK portal. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

articles.title: 3D Visualisation Artist
articles.excerpt: A Perth-based studio is looking for a 3D Visualisation Artist with experience in 3ds Max and V-Ray.
articles.author: Seek
articles.fullContent:
Role Overview

Full-time📍 Perth, WAPosted: Oct 14, 2025

A leading Perth-based architectural studio is seeking a talented 3D Visualisation Artist to join its innovative team. The ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in creating photorealistic architectural renderings and animations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create high-quality 3D visualisations for architectural projects.
  • Work closely with architects and designers to translate concepts into compelling visuals.
  • Utilise 3ds Max, V-Ray, and other software to produce renderings and animations.
  • Ensure all visualisations meet the studio's high standards for quality and accuracy.

Required Qualifications

  • Experience: Demonstrated experience as a 3D Visualisation Artist in the architectural industry.
  • Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in 3ds Max, V-Ray, Corona Renderer, and Adobe Photoshop.
  • Portfolio: A strong portfolio showcasing high-quality, photorealistic architectural visualisations is essential.
  • Soft Skills: Excellent attention to detail and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work on high-profile architectural projects.
  • A creative and supportive studio environment.
  • Competitive remuneration based on experience.
  • State-of-the-art software and hardware.

Application Instructions

Please apply via SEEK with a comprehensive resume and a link to your online portfolio. Only candidates with a portfolio will be contacted.

articles.title: Tesla's Optimus Gen 2 Robot Shows Off Stunning New Capabilities
articles.excerpt: Tesla has unveiled the second generation of its Optimus humanoid robot, which is lighter, faster, and more capable than its predecessor.
articles.author: Live Science
articles.fullContent:
Tesla has revealed its next-generation humanoid robot, Optimus Gen 2. Photo courtesy Tesla.

Tesla Unveils Faster, More Capable Optimus Gen 2 Humanoid Robot

Tesla has released a new demonstration video showcasing the advanced capabilities of its Optimus Gen 2, the next generation of its humanoid robot. The updated prototype is now 10kg lighter, can walk 30% faster, and exhibits significantly improved balance and body control, including the ability to perform squats.

Advanced Manipulation and Sensing

One of the most significant upgrades is the robot's brand-new hands, which feature 11-degrees-of-freedom and tactile sensing on all fingertips. A key demonstration shows the robot delicately handling an egg without breaking it, a task that highlights the advancements in its fine motor skills and sensor technology. This new level of dexterity is crucial for the robot's intended purpose of performing tasks that are unsafe, repetitive, or boring for humans.

The goal for the bipedal autonomous humanoid is to replace humans in the performance of unsafe or boring tasks. — Tesla

The Optimus project, once met with scepticism, is gaining credibility as Tesla leverages its AI expertise from its self-driving vehicle programme. The company aims to eventually use the robots in its own manufacturing operations before making them commercially available.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ Tesla has introduced Optimus Gen 2, a lighter and 30% faster version of its humanoid robot.
  • ✔ The robot features all-new hands with tactile sensing, enabling delicate tasks like handling an egg.
  • ✔ It has improved balance and full-body control, demonstrated by its ability to perform squats.
  • ✔ Tesla plans to use the robot in its own factories to prove its utility before a potential commercial release.

articles.title: Hidden 'Doomed' Star Revealed by James Webb Space Telescope
articles.excerpt: The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has revealed a hidden 'doomed' star that could help solve a giant astrophysical mystery.
articles.author: Patrick Pester
articles.fullContent:
A combined Webb and Hubble view of spiral galaxy NGC 1637, with the region of the red supergiant star shown before and after its explosion. Credit: NASA, ESA, CSA, STScI, Charles Kilpatrick (Northwestern).

Webb Telescope Solves Mystery of 'Missing' Supernovae

The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has identified a massive red supergiant star just before it exploded, solving a long-standing cosmic mystery. For decades, astronomers have wondered why they rarely observe red supergiants exploding, despite theoretical models predicting they should account for most core-collapse supernovae. This discovery confirms that these stars do explode but are often hidden from view by thick clouds of dust.

Piercing the Cosmic Dust

The supernova, named SN 2025pht, occurred in the galaxy NGC 1637, located 38 million light-years from Earth. By comparing new JWST images with archival data from the Hubble Space Telescope, a team led by Northwestern University pinpointed the progenitor star. The star radiated about 100,000 times more light than the Sun, but its thick dust shroud made it appear over 100 times dimmer in visible light. JWST's powerful infrared capabilities allowed it to see through this dust, revealing the doomed star.

"For multiple decades, we have been trying to determine exactly what the explosions of red supergiant stars look like. Only now, with JWST, do we finally have the quality of data and infrared observations that allow us to say precisely the exact type of red supergiant that exploded." — Charlie Kilpatrick, Northwestern University

This observation is the first time JWST has been used to identify a supernova's progenitor star, heralding a new era for studying how the most massive stars live and die.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ JWST has directly identified a red supergiant star that later exploded as a supernova.
  • ✔ The discovery solves the mystery of why these stars were rarely seen exploding; they are often obscured by thick dust clouds.
  • ✔ The star was about 100,000 times more luminous than the sun, but its light was heavily dimmed by the surrounding dust.
  • ✔ This marks the first time JWST has confirmed a supernova's progenitor, opening new avenues for research.

articles.title: Diablo Immortal Adds New Treasure Goblins & Hallow's Wake Returns
articles.excerpt: Diablo Immortal's latest update introduces new treasure goblins, challenges, and the return of the Hallow's Wake event.
articles.author: Blizzard Entertainment
articles.fullContent:
The Hallow's Wake event returns to Diablo Immortal.

Diablo Immortal Update Introduces New Goblins and Hallow's Wake Event

Diablo Immortal's next content update is bringing back the Hallow's Wake limited-time event, alongside an update to the Treasure Goblin system and the new Season 45 Battle Pass. The update will go live after server maintenance on October 14-15, depending on the region.

Ghastly Delights and Greedy Goblins

The popular Hallow's Wake event returns, allowing players to earn Hallowed Stones by defeating goblins and visiting the Crone in Westmarch for daily rewards. These stones can be traded for new cosmetics, Legendary Items, and Crests. A major feature of the update is an overhaul of the Treasure Goblin system, which now includes several new goblin types, each dropping specific loot such as Set items, Legendary Equipment, Gems, and crafting materials.

"The Crone beckons you forth, signaling this season of terror and delight is nigh. Our next content update brings the Season 45 Vessels of the Husk Battle Pass, the arrival of Hallow's Wake, new goblins, and more." — Blizzard News

Additionally, the Season 45 Battle Pass, titled 'Vessels of the Husk,' is set to begin on October 23, offering 40 ranks of rewards for players to earn before it concludes on November 20.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ Diablo Immortal is launching a new update featuring the return of the Hallow's Wake event.
  • ✔ The Treasure Goblin system is being updated with five new types of goblins that drop specific rewards.
  • ✔ The Season 45 Battle Pass, 'Vessels of the Husk,' will be available from October 23.
  • ✔ Players can trade Hallowed Stones during the event for new cosmetics and powerful items.

articles.title: Scientists Achieved Teleportation Using Quantum Supercomputers
articles.excerpt: Scientists have achieved quantum teleportation by sharing data between two quantum computers, enabling them to work together as one supercomputer.
articles.author: Briley Kenney
articles.fullContent:
Quantum computers are being linked to work as one.

Quantum Teleportation Achieved Between Two Computers

Scientists have successfully achieved a form of quantum teleportation, but not in the way science fiction depicts. Rather than moving matter, a University of Oxford team has wirelessly sent a quantum algorithm between two separate quantum processors, allowing them to function as a single, more powerful supercomputer. This breakthrough relies on the principle of quantum entanglement.

The 'Quantum Internet'

Quantum entanglement is a phenomenon where two particles, such as photons or electrons, become linked and remain connected regardless of the distance separating them. This allows information, in the form of qubits (the basic unit of quantum information), to be 'teleported' instantaneously. In the experiment, no particles were physically moved; instead, the data was shared instantly, enabling the two machines to pool their resources and solve problems they couldn't tackle alone.

"This breakthrough enables us to effectively 'wire together' distinct quantum processors into a single, fully-connected quantum computer." — Dougal Main, University of Oxford

This achievement is a critical step towards creating a 'quantum internet' and distributed quantum computing. In such a system, many remote quantum processors could be combined into one unified, ultra-powerful computer, revolutionising fields that require immense computational power.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ Scientists have achieved quantum teleportation of data, not matter, between two quantum computers.
  • ✔ The process uses quantum entanglement to allow two separate processors to work together as one supercomputer.
  • ✔ This breakthrough is a significant step towards developing a distributed 'quantum internet'.
  • ✔ The experiment demonstrated the feasibility of scaling up quantum computing power by networking individual machines.

articles.title: UK Drone Technology Firm Secures £3.65 Million Investment
articles.excerpt: A UK firm developing autonomous aerial solutions, sees.ai, has raised £3.65 million to accelerate its delivery of AI-ready insights for critical national infrastructure.
articles.author: Envirotec Magazine
articles.fullContent:
sees.ai technology enables autonomous drone operations for industrial site monitoring.

sees.ai Secures £3.65 Million to Advance Autonomous Drone Technology

UK-based drone technology firm sees.ai has successfully raised £3.65 million in a new funding round. The investment was led by the investment arm of a major UK-based industrial client and supported by existing investors. The capital will be used to accelerate the company's delivery of autonomous aerial solutions for industrial and urban environments.

AI-Powered Industrial Inspection

sees.ai has developed an artificial intelligence-based system that enables drones to fly autonomously at scale in complex, close-quarter environments, both indoors and outdoors. Their technology is designed to provide AI-ready data and insights for operators of critical national infrastructure, such as in the energy, construction, and transport sectors. The system allows for safer, more efficient, and more consistent data collection for inspection and monitoring tasks.

"This investment will help us to further develop our technology and expand our operations, enabling more industries to benefit from the power of autonomous aerial insights." — sees.ai Representative

The company's solution overcomes the limitations of manual drone operations, which can be labour-intensive and require highly skilled pilots. By automating the process, sees.ai aims to make drone technology a more scalable and accessible tool for large-scale industrial asset management.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ UK drone technology firm sees.ai has raised £3.65 million in a new funding round.
  • ✔ The company develops AI-powered autonomous drones for inspecting and monitoring industrial sites.
  • ✔ The new investment will accelerate the deployment of their technology for critical national infrastructure.
  • ✔ Their autonomous system is designed to be safer, more efficient, and more scalable than manual drone operations.

articles.title: Generative AI Is Coming For The Creative Economy
articles.excerpt: Generative AI is poised to disrupt the creative economy by automating content creation, impacting artists, writers, and designers.
articles.author: Rob Salkowitz
articles.fullContent:
Generative AI tools are set to dramatically reshape creative professions.

How Generative AI is Reshaping the Creative Economy

The rapid advancement of generative artificial intelligence is set to profoundly disrupt the creative economy, automating tasks traditionally performed by artists, writers, designers, and musicians. These AI tools can produce high-quality text, images, and music from simple prompts, raising fundamental questions about the future of creative work and the value of human creativity.

A Double-Edged Sword for Creatives

For some creative professionals, generative AI presents a powerful new set of tools that can augment their skills, accelerate workflows, and open up new avenues of expression. It can handle tedious tasks, generate ideas, and produce assets, freeing up human creators to focus on higher-level strategy and conceptualisation. However, this same technology threatens to devalue and displace human labour in the creative industries.

"The potential for AI to automate creative work is both an opportunity and a threat. It forces us to reconsider what skills are uniquely human and how we can best collaborate with these increasingly capable systems." — Industry Analyst

The debate extends to issues of copyright, originality, and compensation. As AI models are often trained on vast datasets of existing human-created content, questions arise about intellectual property rights and whether human artists should be compensated when their work is used to train these systems. The economic and ethical frameworks of the creative industries are struggling to keep pace with the technology's evolution.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ Generative AI is capable of automating content creation, posing a significant disruption to creative professions.
  • ✔ The technology acts as both a powerful tool for augmenting human creativity and a potential threat to creative jobs.
  • ✔ Key challenges include navigating complex issues of copyright, intellectual property, and fair compensation for artists.
  • ✔ The creative economy must adapt to integrate AI ethically and sustainably, redefining the role of human creators.

articles.title: JWST Spots a Hidden Red Supergiant Just Before It Exploded
articles.excerpt: The James Webb Space Telescope has uncovered a massive red supergiant star just before it exploded, solving a cosmic mystery.
articles.author: ScienceDaily
articles.fullContent:
A combined Webb and Hubble view of the galaxy, with insets showing the red supergiant before and after the explosion. Credit: NASA, ESA, CSA, STScI, Charles Kilpatrick (Northwestern).

Webb Telescope Uncovers Hidden Supergiant, Solving Supernova Mystery

Astronomers using the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) have captured the clearest view ever of a dying star just before its explosive demise, solving a long-standing cosmic puzzle. The telescope identified a massive red supergiant, the source of a supernova, for the first time in mid-infrared light. The finding reveals that these stellar behemoths are often shrouded in thick dust, explaining why they are so rarely seen exploding.

The Dust-Cloaked Giant

The discovery bridges a significant gap between supernova theory and observation. While models predict that red supergiants should be responsible for most core-collapse supernovae, they have been conspicuously absent in observations. This new data suggests they do explode as predicted but are simply hidden from view. JWST's powerful infrared vision was able to pierce through the obscuring dust cloud to find the progenitor star of supernova SN2025pht.

"This breakthrough may finally explain why astronomers rarely see red supergiants explode, even though models predict they should account for most core-collapse supernovae." — ScienceDaily

The star, located in the spiral galaxy NGC 1637 about 40 million light-years from Earth, was found to be about 100,000 times more luminous than the Sun, though much of its light was hidden by the dust. This marks JWST's first confirmed detection of a supernova's progenitor star, opening a new era for studying the final moments of massive stars.

Key Takeaways

  • ✔ The JWST has provided the first mid-infrared identification of a red supergiant star before it went supernova.
  • ✔ The discovery solves the mystery of why red supergiant explosions are rarely seen: they are often hidden by thick dust clouds.
  • ✔ The observed star was extremely luminous but appeared dim in visible light due to its dusty shroud.
  • ✔ This is the first time JWST has been used to confirm a supernova's progenitor, marking a new capability for the telescope.

videos.title: What China Uncovered on Mars
videos.excerpt: China's Zhurong rover has revealed radar evidence of a buried ancient shoreline beneath the Utopia Planitia region on Mars.
